Description: Sandstone gateway, comprising lintel and two door-jambs, reconstructed from fragments, inscribed with an offering formula dedicated to Djedher. Lintel: divided into two sections, on the right Ankhnnesneferibra, followed by her Steward, Sheshonq, stands before Amun-Ra and Khons, on the left Psamtek III presents offerings to Amun-Ra and Tefnet. Left door-jamb: Amun-Ra and Psamtek III hold hands with two Hapy figures beneath tying a papyrus and lily around the sign of unity. Right door-jamb: Psamtek III holds hand of an unidentified goddess, with similar scene of Hapi figures beneath; the inscription is continued on both door-jambs. The upper part of this jamb is on loan from the Medelhavsmuseet, Stockholm.
Findspot: Found/Acquired: Karnak (Thebes), Temple of Osiris Pa-meres
Curator's comments: PM II (2): p.19 Mysliwiec, Royal Portraiture of the Dynasties XXI-XXX (1988): 50
Associated names: Named in inscription & portrayed: Psamtek III
